poem:
"Ode Upon Gray's Forgetfulness"

I who forget
but remember I have
enveloped in conundrum,
The pieces of forgotten
like ripe plums,
cautioned - "Do not ponder."

Your musings, Gray,
on memory's play,
torment my eager pen.
And still, I write,
in feeble light,
for you and all forgotten.
